    <h2 align="center">Rosé Pine for Home Assistant</h2>
</p>

<p align="center">All natural pine, faux fur and a bit of soho vibes for the classy minimalist</p>

<p align="center">
    <a href="https://github.com/rose-pine/rose-pine-theme">
        <img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/community-rosé%20pine-26233a?labelColor=191724&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,&style=for-the-badge" />
    </a>
    <a href="https://my.home-assistant.io/redirect/hacs_repository/?owner=juliamertz&repository=homeassistant-rosepine-theme&category=theme" target="_blank"><img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/open%20in%20hacs-%2341BDF5.svg?style=for-the-badge&logo=home-assistant&logoColor=white" alt="Open your Home Assistant instance and open a repository inside the Home Assistant Community Store." /></a>
</p>



## Usage
### Install using HACS
1. HACS tab > Menu > Custom Repository
2. Paste this repo's URL
3. Select theme in the dropdown
4. Install Rosé Pine for Home Assistant from HACS
5. Home Assistant > Settings > Frontend > Add > Rosé Pine for Home Assistant > Install

#### Note
If the themes don't show up, make sure you add this snippet to `configuration.yaml`
```yaml
frontend:
  themes: !include_dir_merge_named themes
```

### Manual installation
1. Download your favourite variant of rosé pine located in `/themes/` (Both the regular and moon version include dawn as a light option)
2. Move the downloaded folder into `[home assistant config]/themes/`
3. Restart home assistant.

- [juliamertz](https://github.com/juliamertz)

## Contributing


Modify `template.json` using Rosé Pine variables, then build variants with a [xonsh ](https://xon.sh/) script
```sh
./build
```
